meanings.definition: Intimidators: Those who intimidate or frighten others.
meanings.sent1: The intimidators in the movie made the audience jump in fear.
meanings.sent2: The bullies at school were known as the intimidators.
meanings.sent3: The little dog thought he was one of the intimidators, barking at his own reflection.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered like a group of intimidators, ready to unleash their power.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley was filled with shadowy figures, each one a potential intimidator.

meanings.definition: Intimidators: A person or thing that causes fear or apprehension.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunder was the intimidators of the peaceful night.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was the ultimate intimidators for the neighborhood kids.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse became the intimidators of the big cat, scaring it away.
meanings.sent4: The final exam loomed ahead like a giant intimidators, causing stress for the students.
meanings.sent5: The dark forest was full of unseen intimidators, making every step nerve-wracking.
